englishTranslationText: And	We	indeed	did	a	great	favour	to	Moosa	and	Haroon.
romanUrduTranslationText: Aur	be-shak	Ham	ne	Mūsā	aur	hāron	par	eḥsān	farmāyā.

englishTranslationText: And	rescued	them	and	their	people	from	the	great	calamity.
romanUrduTranslationText: Aur	unheñ	aur	un	ki	qaum	ko	badi	sakhti	se	najāt	bakhshi.

englishTranslationText: And	We	helped	them,	so	they	were	victorious.
romanUrduTranslationText: Aur	un	ki	Ham	ne	madad	farmāyi	to	wohi	ghālib	huye.

englishTranslationText: And	We	bestowed	the	clear	Book	to	both	of	them.
romanUrduTranslationText: Aur	Ham	ne	un	donoñ	ko	roshan	kitāb	'aṭā	farmāyi.

englishTranslationText: And	guided	them	to	the	Straight	Path.
romanUrduTranslationText: Aur	un	ko	sidhi	rāh	dikhāyi.

englishTranslationText: And	We	kept	their	praise	among	the	latter	generations.
romanUrduTranslationText: Aur	pichloñ	meiñ	un	ki	t'arif	bāqi	rakhi.

englishTranslationText: Peace	be	upon	Moosa	and	Haroon!
romanUrduTranslationText: Salām	ho	Mūsā	aur	Hāroon	par.

englishTranslationText: This	is	how	We	reward	the	virtuous.
romanUrduTranslationText: Be-shak	Ham	aisā	hi	sila	dete	haiñ	nekoñ	ko.

englishTranslationText: Indeed	they	are	two	of	Our	high	ranking,	firmly	believing	bondmen.
romanUrduTranslationText: Be-shak	woh	donoñ	Hamāre	a'alā	darje	ke	Kāmil-ul-Imān	bandoñ	meiñ	haiñ.

englishTranslationText: And	indeed	Ilyas	is	one	of	the	Noble	Messengers.
romanUrduTranslationText: Aur	be-shak	Ilyās	paighambaroñ	se	hai.

englishTranslationText: When	he	said	to	his	people,	“Do	you	not	fear?”
romanUrduTranslationText: Jab	us	ne	apni	qaum	se	farmāyā	kyā	tum	darte	nahiñ.

englishTranslationText: “What!	You	worship	Baal	(an	idol)	and	leave	the	Best	Creator?”	-
romanUrduTranslationText: Kyā	b'āl	ko	poojte	ho	aur	chodte	ho	sab	se	achchhā	paidā	karne	wāle.

englishTranslationText: “Allah	–	Who	is	your	Lord	and	the	Lord	of	your	forefathers?”
romanUrduTranslationText: Allāh	ko	jo	Rab	hai	tumhārā	aur	tumhāre	agle	bāp	dada	kā.

englishTranslationText:
In	response	they	denied	him,	so	they	will	
surely	be	brought	forth	as	captives.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Phir	unhoñ	ne	usey	jhutlāyā	to	woh	zaroor	
pakde	āayeñ	ge.

englishTranslationText: Except	the	chosen	bondmen	of	Allah.
romanUrduTranslationText: Magar	Allāh	ke	chune	huye	bande.

englishTranslationText:
And	We	kept	his	praise	among	the	latter	
generations.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Aur	ham	ne	pichloñ	meiñ	us	ki	sanā	bāqi	
rakhi.

englishTranslationText: Peace	be	upon	Ilyas!
romanUrduTranslationText: Salām	ho	Ilyās	par.

englishTranslationText: This	is	how	We	reward	the	virtuous.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Be-shak	ham	aisā	hi	sila	dete	haiñ	nekoñ	
ko.

englishTranslationText:
He	is	indeed	one	of	Our	high	ranking,	
firmly	believing	bondmen.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Be-shak	woh	Hamāre	a'alā	darje	ke	Kāmil
ul-Imān	bandoñ	meiñ	hai.

englishTranslationText:
And	indeed	Lut	is	one	of	the	Noble	
Messengers.
romanUrduTranslationText: Aur	be-shak	Lūṭ	Paighambaroñ	meiñ	hai.

englishTranslationText:
When	We	rescued	him	and	his	entire	
household.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Jab	ke	Ham	ne	usey	aur	us	ke	sab	ghar	
wāloñ	ko	najāt	bakhshi.

englishTranslationText:
Except	an	old	woman,	who	became	of	
those	who	stayed	behind.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Magar	aik	budhyā	ke	rah	jāne	wāloñ	meiñ	
huyi.

englishTranslationText: We	then	destroyed	the	others.
romanUrduTranslationText: Phir	dosroñ	ko	Ham	ne	halāk	farmā	diyā.

englishTranslationText:
And	indeed	you	pass	over	them	in	the	
morning.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Aur	be-shak	tum	un	par	guzarte	ho	subḥ	
ko.

englishTranslationText:
And	during	the	night;	so	do	you	not	have	
sense?
romanUrduTranslationText: Aur	rāt	meiñ	to	kyā	tumheñ	'aql	nahiñ.

englishTranslationText:
And	indeed	Yunus	is	one	of	the	Noble	
Messengers.
romanUrduTranslationText: Aur	be-shak	Yūnus	Paighambaroñ	se	hai.

englishTranslationText: When	he	left	towards	the	laden	ship.
romanUrduTranslationText: Jab	ke	bhari	kashti	ki	ṭaraf	nikal	gayā.

englishTranslationText:
Then	lots	were	drawn	and	he	became	of	
those	who	were	pushed	into	the	sea.
romanUrduTranslationText: To	qur'aa	dāla	to	dhakele	huōñ	meiñ	huā.

englishTranslationText:
The	fish	then	swallowed	him	and	he	
blamed	himself.	(For	not	waiting	for	Allah’s	
command.)
romanUrduTranslationText:
Phir	usey	machli	ne	nigal	liyā	aur	woh	
apne	āap	ko	malāmat	kartā	thā.

englishTranslationText: And	were	he	not	one	of	those	who	praise.
romanUrduTranslationText: To	agar	woh	tasbiḥ	karne	wālā	na	hotā.

arabicText: لَلَبِثَ فِى بَطْنِهِۦٓ إِلَىٰ يَوْمِ يُبْعَثُونَ
englishTranslationText: He	would	have	remained	in	its	belly	till	the	day	when	all	will	be	raised.
romanUrduTranslationText: Zaroor	us	ke	pet	meiñ	rahtā	jis	din	tak	log	uthāye	jāyeñ	ge.

englishTranslationText: We	then	put	him	ashore	on	a	plain,	and	he	was	sick.
romanUrduTranslationText: Phir	Ham	ne	usey	maidān	par	dāl	diyā	aur	woh	bimār	thā.

englishTranslationText: And	We	grew	a	tree	of	gourd	(as	a	shelter)	above	him
romanUrduTranslationText: Aur	Ham	ne	us	par	kaddu	kā	pedā	ugāyā.

arabicText: وَأَرْسَلْنَـٰهُ إِلَىٰ مِا۟ئَةِ أَلْفٍ أَوْ يَزِيدُونَ
englishTranslationText: And	We	sent	him	towards	a	hundred	thousand	people,	in	fact	more.
romanUrduTranslationText: Aur	Ham	ne	usey	lākh	āadmiyoñ	ki	ṭaraf	bhejā	balke	ziyāda.

englishTranslationText: So	they	accepted	faith	-	We	therefore	gave	them	usage	for	a	while.
romanUrduTranslationText: To	woh	Imān	le	āaye	to	Ham	ne	unheñ	aik	waqt	tak	baratne	diyā.

englishTranslationText:
Therefore	ask	them	(O	dear	Prophet	Muhammad	-	peace	and	blessings	be	upon	him),	whether	the	
daughters	are	for	your	Lord	and	the	sons	for	them!
romanUrduTranslationText: To	un	se	puñcho	kyā		tumhāre	Rab	ke	liye	betiyāñ	haiñ	aur	un	ke	bete.

arabicText: أَمْ خَلَقْنَا ٱلْمَلَـٰٓئِكَةَ إِنَـٰثًۭا وَهُمْ شَـٰهِدُونَ
englishTranslationText: Or	that	have	We	created	the	angels	as	females,	while	they	were	present?
romanUrduTranslationText: Yā	Ham	ne	malāika	ko'aurateñ	paidā	kiyā		aur	woh	ḥāzir	the.

englishTranslationText: Pay	heed!	It	is	their	slander	that	they	say.	–
romanUrduTranslationText: Sunte	ho	be-shak	woh	apne	buhtān	se	kahte	haiñ.

englishTranslationText: That	“Allah	has	offspring”;	and	indeed,	surely,	they	are	liars.
romanUrduTranslationText: Ke	Allāh	ki	aulād	hai	aur	be-shak	zaroor	woh	jhoote	haiñ.

englishTranslationText: “Has	he	chosen	daughters	instead	of	sons?”
romanUrduTranslationText: Kyā	us	ne	betiyāñ	pasand	kiñ	bete	chord	kar.

englishTranslationText:
“What	is	the	matter	with	you?	What	sort	of	
a	judgement	you	impose!”
romanUrduTranslationText: Tumheñ	kyā	hai	kaisā	ḥukm	lagāte	ho.

englishTranslationText: “So	do	you	not	ponder?”
romanUrduTranslationText: To	kyā	dhayān	nahiñ	karte.

englishTranslationText: “Or	do	you	have	some	clear	proof?”
romanUrduTranslationText: Yā	tumhāre	liye	koyi	khuli	sanad	hai.

englishTranslationText:
“Then	bring	forth	your	Book,	if	you	are	
truthful!”
romanUrduTranslationText: To	apni	kitāb	lāō	agar	sachche	ho.

arabicText: وَجَعَلُوا۟ بَيْنَهُۥ وَبَيْنَ ٱلْجِنَّةِ نَسَبًۭا ۚ وَلَقَدْ عَلِمَتِ ٱلْجِنَّةُ إِنَّهُمْ لَمُحْضَرُونَ
englishTranslationText:
And	they	have	appointed	a	relationship	
between	Him	and	the	jinns;	and	indeed	the	
jinns	surely	know	that	they	will	be	brought	
forth.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Aur	us	meiñ	aur	jinnoñ	meiñ	rishta	tahrāyā	
aur	be-shak	jinnoñ	ko	m'aloom	hai	ke	woh	
zaroor	ḥāzir	lāye	jāyeñ	ge.

englishTranslationText:
Purity	is	to	Allah	from	the	matters	they	
fabricate.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Pāki	hai	Allāh	ko	un	baton	se	ke	ye	batāte	
haiñ.

englishTranslationText: Except	the	chosen	bondmen	of	Allah.
romanUrduTranslationText: Magar	Allāh	ke	chune	huye	bande.

englishTranslationText:
Therefore	you	and	all	what	you	worship.	
(The	disbelievers	and	their	deities.)
romanUrduTranslationText:
To	tum	aur	jo	kuch	tum	Allāh	ke	siwā	
poojte	ho.

englishTranslationText: You	cannot	make	anyone	rebel	against	Him
romanUrduTranslationText:
Tum	us	ke	khilāf	kisi	ko	bahkāne	wāle	
nahiñ.

englishTranslationText:
Except	the	one	who	will	go	into	the	blazing	
fire.
romanUrduTranslationText: Magar	usey	jo	bhadakti	āag	meiñ	jāne	wālā	hai

arabicText: وَمَا مِنَّآ إِلَّا لَهُۥ مَقَامٌۭ مَّعْلُومٌۭ
englishTranslationText:
And	the	angels	say,	“Each	one	of	us	has	an	
appointed	known	position.”
romanUrduTranslationText:
Aur	farishte	kahte	haiñ	ham	meiñ	har	aik	kā	aik	
maqām	m'aloom	hai.

englishTranslationText:
“And	indeed	we,	with	our	wings	spread,	
await	the	command.”
romanUrduTranslationText:
Aur	be-shak	ham	par	phailāye	ḥukm	ke	
muntazir	haiñ.

englishTranslationText:
“And	indeed	we	are	those	who	say	His	
purity.”
romanUrduTranslationText: Aur	be-shak	ham	us	ki	tasbiḥ	karne	wāle	haiñ.

englishTranslationText:
“And	indeed	we	are	those	who	say	His	
purity.”
romanUrduTranslationText: Aur	be-shak	woh	kahte	the.

arabicText: لَوْ أَنَّ عِندَنَا ذِكْرًۭا مِّنَ ٱلْأَوَّلِينَ
englishTranslationText:
“If	we	had	some	advice	from	the	earlier	
generations,”	-
romanUrduTranslationText: Agar	hamare	pās	agloñ	ki	koyi	nasiḥat	hoti.

englishTranslationText: “We	would	certainly	be	the	chosen	bondmen	of	Allah.”
romanUrduTranslationText: To	zaroor	ham	Allāh	ke	chune	bande	hote.

englishTranslationText: They	therefore	denied	it,	so	they	will soon come to know
romanUrduTranslationText: To	us	ke	munkir	huye	to	'anqarib	jān	leñ	ge.

englishTranslationText: And	indeed	Our	Word	has	already	gone	forth	for	Our	bondmen	who	were	sent.
romanUrduTranslationText: Aur	be-shak	Hamārā	kalām	guzar	chuka	hai	Hamāre	bheje	huye	bandoñ	ke	liye.
